To: nbwrpg@egroups.com

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"

X-Mailer: CompuServe 2000 32-bit sub 107

The Protectobots:


The Dimentia hit the mountain hard, slamming into the rocky terrain as well, 
but then slid down a hundred feet and flipped, landing on its top, smashing 
inward.

Hot Spot shook hi shead, glad he had put on his harness.  Luckily he wasn't 
beyond the repairs internal repairs could fix up.  He looked around, and by 
his scans, he and the four other Protectobots were the only ones alive on the 
bridge.  He should've figured.  None of the other Maximals were as armored as 
them. None of them had been prepped for battle.  A shot from a laser pistol 
the chest would've probably killed them off.

"GET UP!" he yelled, checking the scans. 

Groove slowly got up.  "I hate Predacons!" he yelled.  "We should kill them 
one by one!"

Hot Spot was just a tad bit surprised at this.  Usually Groove was relaxed 
and happy, and he was a known pacifist.  But evidently, the death had changed 
him for the moment.  Understandable.

Blades looked at the other Protectobots.  "Groove is right!  I say we kick 
Pred skid plate!  We've been nice neighbors long enough!"

First Aid checked the main scanners.  "Every Maximal is dead on this ship 
according to my readings.  We can't let this go unpunished."

"I say we thrash all the Preds we find." Streetwise sighed, making sure his 
arm wasn't damaged.  When he concluded it wasn't and it just hurt, he looked 
to Hot Spot for an answer.

The Protectobot leader sighed.  "Is there a battle?"

"I'd say so!" First Aid yelled.  "There's a gargantuan of a battle at 
the...Cybertronian Fire.  It's the CF!"

"We've found it." Hot Spot smiled.  "Let's roll out!" he yelled, transforming 
into his blue fire truck mode, driving out of the ship and towards the CF.

Groove transformed into his police motorcycle form and followed, thinking of 
revenge, which wasn't like him.

First Aid transformed to his ambulance mode, following Hot Spot at his top 
speed.

Streetwise transformed to his police car mode, folloiwng.

Blades ran after them, not being dumb enough to transform into his alternate 
mode indoors.  When he stepped out onto the grass, he jumped up, his body 
shaping into a helicopter, the blades twirling quickly, the Maximal gaining 
altitude and flying at the same speed as his comrades below him, all heading 
for the Cybertronian Fire.
